Build ID: I20070503-1400

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create and launch a MySQL agent from the launch config
2. Once the agent appears in the Profile Monitor, press 'Start Monitoring'.
3. Observe that the agent terminates itself.


More information:
This may be a problem with the AC, since the agent itself hasn't changed since the last successfully tested TPTP build.

For JDBC connectivity, I was using mysql-connector-java-5.0.6-bin.jar
Need to resolve this in i4.

HW - IBM Thinkpad T41

JVM - jre1.5.0_09

==================================

HW - IBM eServer xSeries 306 (8489-4Ty)
OS - Ubuntu Linux 5.1.0

Agent Controller log with DEBUG on

1. Start the AC
2. Try to launch a MySQL agent
3. Stop the AC

Created an attachment (id=68641)
Another AC log using the TPTP 4.4 driver (TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100Y)

I edited the pluginconfig.xml to activate logging for the MySQL agent, and set the value of SYS_TEMP_DIR in the serviceconfig.xml to "C:\temp" before starting the AC and then trying to start a MySQL agent.

The agent terminated itself very quickly after pressing 'Start Monitoring' in the Profile Monitor view, but no MySQL.log file was generated.

I was able to successfully launch and monitor the MySQL agent when MySQL was installed on my client Windows machine.

From the Agent Controller log that is attached, it appears as if the agent cannot connect to the remote MySQL database.  Are you sure the database is configured so it can be connected from remote systems and that all of the agent settings (db name, user, password) in the launch configuration are correct?  Are there any firewall issues that would prevent connections to the MySQL system?
